Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 4/24/2016 at 10:48 AM, emerald said:
> 
> 
> Is it possible to provide a tweakscale menu for inactive (red in VAB/SPH, not attached to root part) parts? Now it's required to attach a part and scale afterwards, however scaling beforehand would be easier in many places.
> 

> 
> 
> 40 minutes ago, pellinor said:
> 
> 
> Changing how/when the game shows right click menus would be out of scope for this mod. All it does at the moment is attaching a "tweakable" object to a variable, everything else is organized automagically by the game.
> 

In KSP 1.0.5 it was possible to see Right Click Menu's on unattached parts. However in KSP 1.1 this functionality appears to have been removed.

I seem to be unable to get Tweakscale working with KSP version 1.1.0.1230. I just downloaded this KSP version this morning. At first i thought it was caused because i was using the 64 bit KSP version, but it doesn't work in the 32 bit KSP version. I've removed almost all mods (only Toolbar and AVC still remaining) but to no avail.

Are there any others which have the same problem?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-26T16:08:59Z" title="04/26/2016 04:08  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 26, 2016</time> by TheCardinal**
  
Typo's

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, TheCardinal said:
> 
> 
> I seem to be unable to get Tweakscale working with KSP version 1.1.0.1230. I just downloaded this KSP version this morning. At first i thought it was caused because i was using the 64 bit KSP version, but it doesn't work in the 32 bit KSP version. I've removed almost all mods (only Toolbar and AVC still remaining) but to no avail.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Are there any others which have the same problem?
> 

As far as I understand you will also need ModuleManager to be able to add functionality to parts.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-26T19:41:16Z" title="04/26/2016 07:41  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 26, 2016</time> by Graphi**

> 
> 
> 35 minutes ago, Graphi said:
> 
> 
> As far as I understand you will also need ModuleManager to be able to add functionality to parts.
> 

Thank you very much, Graphi. You've solved my problem. I did have ModuleManager but i found out it was the wrong version (2.6.20 instead of 2.6.23). Replacing the old version with the new version solved my problem. Thank you once again.
Np ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") .
i cant scale the engines in mk2 expansion anymore ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, ThePixeledFox said:
> 
> 
> i cant scale the engines in mk2 expansion anymore ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")
> 

[@ThePixeledFox](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/153405-thepixeledfox/) Hey, it didn't for me either, make sure you have the latest version (v2.2.7.2) - [http://spacedock.info/mod/127/TweakScale](http://spacedock.info/mod/127/TweakScale)![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

[Seems like we have a problem with dragCube scaling.](https://github.com/pellinor0/TweakScale/issues/25)A small 1.25m rocket has a terminal velocity of about 100m/s when using a stock tank. When I use a downscaled version of the largest Kerbodyne tank, this drops to about 30m/s. So something broke with dragcube scaling, probably drag not scaled at all at the moment.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-27T22:24:07Z" title="04/27/2016 10:24  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 27, 2016</time> by pellinor**
how do i resize something? i right click and there is no option to resize

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, App24 said:
> 
> 
> how do i resize something? i right click and there is no option to resize
> 

Check if you have ModuleManager installed and if it is version 2.6.23). Remove all older versions of ModuleManager you have. Right click will then work. (I had the same problem).

> 
> 
> 11 hours ago, TheCardinal said:
> 
> 
> Check if you have ModuleManager installed and if it is version 2.6.23). Remove all older versions of ModuleManager you have. Right click will then work. (I had the same problem).
> 

There is only modulemanager 2.6.22. I have that same version. I tried to find that version(2.6.23) but I goes to the page of the mod and it says that the version is 2.6.22. But if Im wrong tell me. EDIT: Found It. EDIT: Still doesnt work.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-28T17:03:43Z" title="04/28/2016 05:03  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 28, 2016</time> by App24**
Are you sure you've removed all prior versions?

I found a Mod that had TweakScale and MM inside its folder

Search your game folder for Module Manager and TweakScale. bet you find it buried in another mod.

I found mine in the LeTech Mod

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-29T05:53:18Z" title="04/29/2016 05:53  AM" data-short="8 yr">April 29, 2016</time> by OmegaMan**

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, TheCardinal said:
> 
> 
> Are you sure you've removed all prior versions?
> 

Yeah I did.

I'm sorry if this has been answered before, but is tweak scale ever going to resolve the problems with the b9 aerospace parts (specifically the HX parts)?

EDIT: Fixed it.  It seemed like the problem was 1.1.0.  So I updated all of my mods.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-01T15:32:30Z" title="05/01/2016 03:32  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 1, 2016</time> by TwinKerbal**
  
saying why i fixed it
When I tweaked a fuel tank (stocked & SpaceY) smaller, its mass became negative. I cant find out why. Is anyone else having the same problem? Both KSP and TW are the latest version.
My TweakScale seems to not be adding resources when I enlarge them. I am using KSP 1.1.1, but every other mod that hasn't been updated past 1.1 is working fine. Any suggestions?

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, TwinKerbal said:
> 
> 
> I'm sorry if this has been answered before, but is tweak scale ever going to resolve the problems with the b9 aerospace parts (specifically the HX parts)?
> 

Which problems? The only thing I ma aware of is the new B9 partswitch module, which does not support TweakScale yet. But this needs to happen in the partswitch module since it stores its information in a way that TweakScale can not access.

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, QiJian said:
> 
> 
> When I tweaked a fuel tank (stocked & SpaceY) smaller, its mass became negative. I cant find out why. Is anyone else having the same problem? Both KSP and TW are the latest version.
> 

With stock+TweakScale I can't reproduce this. Any other mods that touch part mass, like fuel switches? Where do you see the negative mass? Engineer's report? mechjeb?

In editor or flight? 1.1 changed how part mass adjustments work (in flight), so new mod interaction bugs would not be a surprise. But we need a reproduction with a minimum of mods in order to find them.

> 
> 
> 16 minutes ago, pellinor said:
> 
> 
> With stock+TweakScale I can't reproduce this. Any other mods that touch part mass, like fuel switches? Where do you see the negative mass? Engineer's report? mechjeb?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> In editor or flight? 1.1 changed how part mass adjustments work (in flight), so new mod interaction bugs would not be a surprise. But we need a reproduction with a minimum of mods in order to find them.
> 

I deleteed B9 part switch, then problem solved. ：）

I can see the negative dry mass when click the middle buttons in editor , just FYI.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-30T12:53:16Z" title="04/30/2016 12:53  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 30, 2016</time> by QiJian**

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Ewypig said:
> 
> 
> My TweakScale seems to not be adding resources when I enlarge them. I am using KSP 1.1.1, but every other mod that hasn't been updated past 1.1 is working fine. Any suggestions?
> 

> 
> 
> On 27.4.2016 at 0:25 AM, App24 said:
> 
> 
> how do i resize something? i right click and there is no option to resize
> 

See if it works with stock+tweakScale, then add other mods back in.

For resource nodes not scaling, the most likely candidate is MFT, which to my knowledge does not support TweakScale currently (and the fix might take some time since its developers are quite busy fixing stock bugs).

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-30T12:38:54Z" title="04/30/2016 12:38  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 30, 2016</time> by pellinor**
Bad news, 1.1.2 now. TW isn't working.

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, pellinor said:
> 
> 
> See if it works with stock+tweakScale, then add other mods back in.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> For resource nodes not scaling, the most likely candidate is MFT, which to my knowledge does not support TweakScale currently (and the fix might take some time since its developers are quite busy fixing stock bugs).
> 

thank you, what is MFT?

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, Ewypig said:
> 
> 
> thank you, what is MFT?
> 

modular fuel tanks (or realFuels, which uses the same code)

[Release v2.2.9](https://github.com/pellinor0/TweakScale/releases/tag/v2.2.9) for KSP 1.1.2:  

\* fix for drag cube scaling  

\* update right click menu after rescale  

\* recompile for 1.1.2  

\* cleanup for mass scaling
